file_content.text: Crude, but effective.
I am Magra-Su. All potentials must face me.
The trials are dangerous. I meet more corpses than men.
I was told to complete your trials. Dying wasn't an option.
Failure is unacceptable.
You came closer than you know.
Failures don't deserve the Mystics' power.
Your corpses were weak.
Most who survive already have it.
My corpses are usually walking.
Story of my life, lady.
We do what we must.
To survive a Mystic's trials, you need to think like one.
They didn't understand.
Few are capable.
If the trials are worth dying for, I don't see why.
Why risk their lives?
A Mystic must know his role. This is the first trial.
Focus and meditation, the second. Healing and balance, the third.
The dead would disagree.
The Mystics guide the Voss. The trials teach them how.
Only one with a Mystic's understanding can defeat the Gormak. You have passed.
What does an outsider get for passing the trials?
Meaning what, exactly?
I played your games. I expect something in return.
Great. Now reward me.
Outsiders have a strange concept of worth.
The true honor comes now.
The trials bring clarity. A Mystic's power is awakened.
You have learned to see. A vision will be granted.
How can I have a vision if I'm not a Mystic?
I thought that was impossible.
I will see. You will tell me where to look.
You remain an outsider. Your thoughts are brief, unfocused.
The vision will be yours. I cannot determine its worth.
Look upon the ancient tablets. A vision will come.
[You have seen your vision. The tablet is silent.]
Focus. Your vision will come.
Excellent. Now I know I will get my chance to face you.
This pleases me.
A wish granted does not always bring success.
Even your apparition makes me feel murderous.
I will kill that man.
Your impotence is laughable.
So be it. I am not afraid of death.
If I die, I die.
The end is near. You will be forgotten.
I asked for a vision, not another ghost.
Not you again.
You focused and saw me. What do you fear, I wonder?
You want me dead. I already knew that.
I'm not surprised.
Perhaps I am not the only one who does.
There's someone else who wants to kill me?
Who's "we"?
You know the Sith way. Or perhaps you don't.
I don't plan on dying.
You'll fail.
When the time comes, I will not need your approval.
Should've thought of that before you framed me.
You brought this on yourself.
The road to perdition is paved with good intentions.
What fallout? What are you talking about?
I'm not one for suspense.
The truth will be revealed.
You'll be removed in a body bag.
Only one way for this to end.
If that's what you really want.
The only one left... am I really going to win?
Does this mean I'll beat you?
That depends. How much can you sacrifice and still call it a victory?
"One last thing," Hunter.
Show me.
Shh.
Vision or not, I've always wanted to do this.
Another time. [Shoot Hunter.]
Ha! Ha!
The vision is over. You have seen what comes.
There must be some way to change it.
Can I stop it?
A Mystic is never wrong.
All I saw was a ghost talking nonsense.
I don't understand.
You saw your future. I cannot interpret it.
That told me nothing. Look again.
Show me more.
The vision is over.
The Mystics have seen you defeat the Gormak. You are worthy to fight.
Gorma-Koss is our battlefield. Telsin-Fal is in command. Destroy the ship. Keep the Gormak from the stars.
A Mystic sees. The Voss respond.
The trials have ended. Leave now.
[Nothing happens.]
The unworthy Empire also seeks the power of the Mystics.
You know this power. Darth Serevin will need your help.
If we are to conquer our enemies, Zash's former apprentice must die.
The fallout will be tremendous. No matter how our meeting concludes, I'll be removed from office.
Had enough, child? Can you feel your grip on life slipping?
It's your responsibility now--everything we built, everything we hid from you... you're the only one like us left.
You'll take good care of it. But between you and me... I want to show you one last thing.
Your trials aren't so hard.
This was a great honor.
I'm ready to accept it.
Of something useful, I hope.
